title: Start Screen
text: In the Product Configurator, items can be restricted in two ways. Firstly, an item can be flagged as "Age Restricted," which requires the clerk to determine if the customer is legally allowed to purchase the item based on their age. Secondly, the quantity of items that can be purchased together in a single transaction can be restricted using the "Restricted Quantity" field. When a restricted item is scanned, both the Tri Light and SCO Companion will display an orange status. This indicates that although it doesn't block the customer from proceeding with the transaction, it presents an opportunity for the clerk to remotely approve the restriction. By approving the restriction promptly, the clerk can facilitate a faster checkout process for the customer.

title: Composer View
text: Composer View is where a customer will make their selections for items ordered through the Kiosk. The Kiosk will always display the Landing Group for the selected store as the start point for this navigation. This hierarchy and navigation can be further expanded upon and fully customised using the Composer Groups functionality in Visual Composer. You have the option to explore subgroups (black tiles) to access deeper levels of the hierarchy. Additionally, you can use the +/- buttons to add items to your basket. When pressing the + button on a Bundle or an item with Modifiers, you will be prompted to make your selections before adding it to the basket. The Kiosk system is aware of your current stock levels. Therefore, if an item is a stock keeping item and you have run out of stock, it will be displayed as "Sold Out" to prevent customers from making a purchase. There are various ways a customer can navigate within the page. Icon Meaning Function On Screen Navigation If you have Bundle Groups set up, you will see navigation buttons appear when in those groups. For example Home > Drinks > Pepsi / Sprite / Coke. you can use this to return to the Home Screen or to a section by selecting on the POS. Information Button This button will show the user your Terms and Conditions, FAQ, Delivery Information and Privacy Policy, if you have them configured. Currently, only Consultants are able to add this content. Supervisor Functions This button will ask you for a PIN code to enter supervisor functions. Tile Button The tile button if pressed will return you back to your home group from wherever you are in the application. Product Information Any tile with the i symbol means there is some more information you might want to see for an item. It also indicates that there may be Bundle Groups or Modifiers for the item when selected. Basket Button The basket button shows you how many items you have in your basket. You can press the button to view the basket, which you have to do in order to proceed to Payment.

title: Supervisor Functions
text: To access the Supervisor Functions in the Kiosk, follow these steps: Locate the settings cog icon in the top right-hand corner of the Kiosk interface. Click on the settings cog icon. You will be prompted to enter a supervisor PIN. Enter the supervisor PIN provided to you. If the entered PIN is correct and you have the necessary supervisor permissions, you will gain access to the Supervisor Functions. Please note that the supervisor permissions are set up in the Configuration, and only users with the appropriate authorization will be able to access the Supervisor Functions. You will then be presented with the following functions that a supervisor is perform via kiosk. Here are the explanations for the remaining functions in the Kiosk Supervisor Functions: Full Screen: This function toggles the display between full screen mode and regular mode. Please note that when using Kiosk mode in Chrome, the full screen function may not work as it is overridden by the browser's settings. Choose Arm Device: The term "Arm" refers to the Connector. In this function, you can select from a list of Connectors that you have set up in the Admin settings. If you don't have a physical Arm device, you can use the Virtual Connector as an alternative. However, please be aware that the Virtual Connector should not be used in a live environment, as it bypasses payment processing and assumes a full payment has been made. Refresh Kiosk: Selecting this option will clear the current basket, return you to the start screen, and reload all the Composer tiles. It allows you to start fresh and begin a new transaction. These functions provide additional control and customization options for supervisors using the Kiosk system.

To access the Supervisor Functions in the Kiosk, follow these steps:

  • Locate the settings cog icon in the top right-hand corner of the Kiosk interface.
  • Click on the settings cog icon.
  • You will be prompted to enter a supervisor PIN.
  • Enter the supervisor PIN provided to you.
  • If the entered PIN is correct and you have the necessary supervisor permissions, you will gain access to the Supervisor Functions.
  • Please note that the supervisor permissions are set up in the Configuration, and only users with the appropriate authorization will be able to access the Supervisor Functions.



You will then be presented with the following functions that a supervisor is perform via kiosk.



Here are the explanations for the remaining functions in the Kiosk Supervisor Functions:


Full Screen: This function toggles the display between full screen mode and regular mode. Please note that when using Kiosk mode in Chrome, the full screen function may not work as it is overridden by the browser's settings.


Choose Arm Device: The term "Arm" refers to the Connector. In this function, you can select from a list of Connectors that you have set up in the Admin settings. If you don't have a physical Arm device, you can use the Virtual Connector as an alternative. However, please be aware that the Virtual Connector should not be used in a live environment, as it bypasses payment processing and assumes a full payment has been made.


Refresh Kiosk: Selecting this option will clear the current basket, return you to the start screen, and reload all the Composer tiles. It allows you to start fresh and begin a new transaction.


These functions provide additional control and customization options for supervisors using the Kiosk system.

title: Items / Bundles / Modifiers
text: When you add a Bundle or Modifiable item to your basket in the Kiosk, you will be prompted to make the necessary selections or modifications before adding them to the basket. This ensures that you can customize your order according to your preferences. If the Bundle main item has Modifiers linked to it, the Kiosk will automatically direct you to the Modifiers tab, providing you with the option to make any desired alterations to the modifiers associated with the item. This allows you to tailor the item to your specific requirements before finalizing your order. For non-bundled items with Modifiers in the Kiosk, only the Modifiers will be shown to you. You won't see any other bundled items in this case. Next to the Modifier title, you will find the min-max rule for the selections, which indicates the allowed range or limits for choosing the modifiers. Additionally, any additional prices associated with the modifiers will be displayed. It's important to note that any modifications you make to the item, including the chosen modifiers, will be printed on the order confirmation slip. Furthermore, these modifications will be reflected in the Order Status Display, which is used in the order preparation area. This ensures that your customizations are accurately communicated for the preparation of your order. Modifications made during the ordering process are seamlessly incorporated into the system. These modifications are effectively recorded and conveyed through two channels: Order Confirmation Slip: The order confirmation slip, generated upon completion of the order, includes a comprehensive summary of all the modifications made. This ensures that the printed confirmation slip provides a clear and detailed record of the customized order. Order Status Display: The modifications are also transmitted to the Order Status Display, which serves as a visual reference for the order preparation area. The Order Status Display prominently presents the modifications, ensuring that the staff can easily access and implement them during the order preparation process. By integrating modifications into both the order confirmation slip and the Order Status Display, the system facilitates accurate and efficient communication of customizations, streamlining the overall order fulfillment workflow. Basket The Basket screen shows a list of your items, along with any bundle selections and modifiers you have made. They are grouped together, so if you have made more than one item with the same selections and modifiers they will be on the same basket line. It clearly denotes the extended price of the basket line and also displays the quantity multiplied by the single item price. Icon Name Function Edit Line You can use the pencil icon for the basket line to make alterations to that line (change modifiers or bundle selections). Delete Line Use the trash can icon to remove the line from the basket. Delete Basket Use the black trash can next to the Pay button to clear the basket and return to the start screen. Pay Button Use the Continue button to proceed to the payment phase.

title: Time Out / Payment
text: Idle Timeout When using the Composer View or the Basket View in the Kiosk, an "idle" timer is continuously running in the background. This timer is designed to monitor user activity and engagement. If no action is taken within the defined timeframe, the Kiosk will issue a warning indicating that the basket will be emptied and you will be returned to the start screen after a specific number of seconds. This feature serves as a reminder to keep the session active and prevents prolonged periods of inactivity, ensuring an efficient and responsive user experience. Providing a warning before emptying the basket and returning to the start screen, allows users to take appropriate action or continue their interaction with the Kiosk to avoid unintended disruptions. This idle timeout is configurable. Payment Pressing the Pay button will, unless you are using the Virtual connector for testing and demo purposes, initiate the Connector to instruct the Pin Entry Device to make a payment. At this point, the Kiosk has handed over control and is awaiting further input. You will see the below screen whilst it is processing. On this screen, the idle timeout is ignored and instead uses whatever configurable timeout is used for that PED, and that will vary between payment providers. If the payment fails, you will be advised and after 5 seconds it will return you to the basket to try another card. You should refer to the PED for details on why the transaction was declined, as each provider is different, so we only display a failure. NOTE: You will also see a failure if the Kiosk is unable to communicate with the Connector. If the payment is successful, then it means that the payment has been made and the transaction has been submitted to Imagine's back-end for onward processing. It will now. Submit the order to the Order Status Display. Return you an order number which is displayed on the screen and used in the OSD and ORB. Print an order confirmation slip including the order number and any bundle selections and modifiers which are applied. Show you the estimated waiting time, which it calculates based on the last 15 minutes of order throughput. Before returning the user to the start screen. The Estimated Waiting Time can be hidden from this screen if configured to do so in Self-Serve Admin.
